* Initializes a new James chatbot instance.
* Sets up the user interface and storage, and attempts to load existing tasks from the disk.

* Displays a greeting and continuously reads and executes user commands
* until an exit command is issued.
* The main method that serves as the entry point for the application.

* Parses the raw user input into a specific Command object.

* @return A Command object corresponding to the user's intent.
* @throws JamesException If the command is unknown, the format is incorrect,
* or the task index is out of bounds.
public static Command parseCommand(String fullCommand, TaskList tasks) throws JamesException {
* Parses a single line from the data storage file into a Task object.

* Saves the current list of tasks to the hard disk.
* Creates the directory and file if they do not exist before writing.

public void saveTasks(TaskList tasks) throws JamesException {
throw new JamesException("Could not create file");

/** The decorative line used to separate message blocks in the console. */

* Prints a horizontal divider line to the console.
* Displays the greeting message when the application starts.
System.out.println("  What can I do for you?");

System.out.println("  You take care bro. Hope to see you again soon!");

System.out.println("  Here you go bro! Here's your list.");
* Confirms that a task has been successfully marked as done.
* @param tasks The TaskList containing the task.
* @param taskNumber The 1-indexed position of the task.
public void markTask(TaskList tasks, int taskNumber) {
System.out.println("  No problem man! I've marked this task as done:");
* Confirms that a task has been successfully unmarked.
* @param tasks The TaskList containing the task.
* @param taskNumber The 1-indexed position of the task.
public void unmarkTask(TaskList tasks, int taskNumber) {
System.out.println("  I got you bro! I've marked this task as not done yet:");
* Confirms that a new task has been added and displays the new list size.
* @param taskList The TaskList after the addition.
System.out.println("  Say less bro. I've added this task for you:");
System.out.println("  Now you have " + taskList.getSize() + " tasks in your list!");
* Showing the confirmation message of the removal of a task.
* @param deletedTask The task we just deleted.
* @param remainingSize The size of task list after the deletion.
public void deleteTask(Task deletedTask, int remainingSize) {
System.out.println("  You bet dawg. I have removed this task for you:");
System.out.println("  Now you have " + remainingSize + " tasks in your list!");

* Represents an executable command in the James application.
* This abstract class serves as the base for all specific command types,
* ensuring they implement logic for execution and indicate whether
* Indicates whether this command is a termination command.
* * @return True if the application should exit after this command, false otherwise.
* Executes the specific logic associated with the command.
* This may involve modifying the task list, interacting with the UI,
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be operated on.
* @param ui The user interface for displaying messages.
* @param storage The storage system for saving and loading data.
* @throws JamesException If an error occurs during the execution of the command.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JamesException;
* Handles the creation and addition of various task types to the task list.
* This command can instantiate Todo, Deadline, or Event objects based on
* the provided task type and descriptions.
/** The type of task to create (e.g., "todo", "deadline", "event"). */
/** An array containing description parts (e.g., task name, start time, end time). */
/** The due date for deadline tasks; null for other task types. */
* Initializes a CreateTaskCommand with the necessary data to build a task.
* @param taskType The category of the task.
* @param descriptions The array of strings containing task details.
* @param deadlineTime The LocalDate for deadlines, or null if not applicable.
public CreateTaskCommand(String taskType, String[] descriptions, LocalDate deadlineTime) {
* Returns the type of task this command is responsible for creating.
* Returns the description parts used to create the task.
* Returns the deadline time associated with this command.
* @return Always false as adding a task does not terminate the program.
* Logic to instantiate the specific Task subclass, add it to the list,
* and trigger the UI confirmation message.
* @param tasks The TaskList where the new task will be added.
* @param ui The UI used to confirm the addition to the user.
* @param storage The storage system (not directly used by this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to remove a task from the task list.
* This command handles the deletion logic and provides multi-step feedback to the user.
/** The 1-indexed position of the task to be deleted. */
* Initializes a DeleteTaskCommand with the specified task index.
* @param taskNumber The position of the task in the list (1-indexed).
* * @return Always false as deleting a task does not exit the application.
* Executes the deletion by first showing the task to be removed,
* removing it from the task list, and then displaying the updated task count.
* @param tasks The TaskList from which the task will be removed.
* @param ui The UI used to display the confirmation messages.
* @param storage The storage system (not directly used by this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to search for a task including specific contents in the task list.
* This command handles the searching logic and provide the according tasks to the user.
// The key word used in searching
* Initializes a FindCommand with the specific key word given.
* @param keyWord The specific key word that we need to look up in the task description.
* * @return Always false as searching through tasks does not exit the application.
* Executes the deletion by first showing the task to be removed,
* removing it from the task list, and then displaying the updated task count.
* @param tasks The TaskList from which the task will be removed.
* @param ui The UI used to display the confirmation messages.
* @param storage The storage system (not directly used by this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to display all tasks currently in the task list.
* This command triggers the UI to format and print the entire collection of tasks.
* * @return Always false as listing tasks does not terminate the program.
* Triggers the UI to display the current list of tasks to the user.
* @param tasks The TaskList to be displayed.
* @param ui The UI used to format and print the list.
* @param storage The storage system (not used by this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to mark a specific task as completed.
* This command updates the status of the task in the task list and
* triggers a confirmation message to the user.
/** The 1-indexed position of the task to be marked as done. */
* Initializes a MarkCommand with the specified task index.
* @param taskNumber The position of the task in the list (1-indexed).
* @return Always false as marking a task does not exit the application.
* Updates the status of the specified task to "done" and displays
* the updated task details via the UI.
* @param tasks The TaskList containing the task to be marked.
* @param ui The UI used to display the completion confirmation.
* @param storage The storage system (not directly used by this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Represents a command to safely terminate the James chatbot application.
* This command handles the final saving of data to the hard disk and
* displays the departure message to the user.
* @return Always true, signaling the main application loop to terminate.
* Saves the current state of the task list to storage and displays
* @param tasks The TaskList to be saved before exiting.
* @param ui The UI used to display the "bye" message.
* @param storage The storage system used to persist the task data.
* @throws JamesException If an error occurs during the file saving process.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) throws JamesException {
* Represents a command to mark a specific task as not completed yet.
* This command updates the status of the task in the task list and
* triggers a corresponding confirmation message via the UI.
/** The 1-indexed position of the task to be unmarked. */
* Initializes an UnmarkCommand with the specified task index.
* @param taskNumber The position of the task in the list (1-indexed).
* @return Always false as unmarking a task does not terminate the program.
* Updates the status of the specified task to "not done" and displays
* the updated task details to the user.
* @param tasks The TaskList containing the task to be updated.
* @param ui The UI used to display the unmarking confirmation.
* @param storage The storage system (not used by this command).
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Exception thrown when the application is unable to locate the specified
* data storage file on the hard disk.
* This typically occurs during the initialization phase if the data folder
* or file does not yet exist.
* Constructs a new CanNotFindFileException with a friendly warning message.
* @param message The original detail message explaining the file's absence
super("I can not find such a file man!");
* Exception thrown when the application encounters an I/O error while
* attempting to save task data to the local storage file.
* This class translates technical file system errors into a message
* Constructs a new CanNotWriteToFileException with a predefined error message.
* @param message The original technical error message from the I/O failure
super("Opps man! I can not write to your file 'task.txt'.");
* Exception thrown when a user provides a command that requires a description,
* but leaves the description field blank.
* This class ensures that the user is informed exactly which task type
* Constructs a new EmptyDescriptionException with a message specifying
* the task type that was missing a description.
* @param taskType The type of task being created (e.g., "todo", "deadline")
super("the description of a " + taskType + " can not be EMPTY, bro!");
* Exception thrown when a user's command does not follow the expected syntax.
* Provides specific factory methods to generate error messages for deadlines,
* Private constructor to enforce the use of static factory methods.
* @param message The detailed error message to be displayed to the user.
* Returns an instance for cases where a date string cannot be parsed.
* @return An InvalidFormatException with date format instructions.
return new InvalidFormatException("Hey man, you need to input your date in the format of 'yyyy-MM-dd'.");
* Returns an instance for cases where a deadline command is missing the '/by' delimiter.
* @return An InvalidFormatException with deadline syntax instructions.
return new InvalidFormatException("Bro, deadlines need a '/by' time! Use: deadline [desc] /by [time]");
* Returns an instance for cases where an event command is missing '/from' or '/to' delimiters.
* @return An InvalidFormatException with event syntax instructions.
return new InvalidFormatException("Nah man, events need '/from' and '/to'! Use: event [desc] /from [s] /to [e]");
* Exception thrown when a command requires a task number, but the input
* is missing, not a valid integer, or outside the range of the task list.
* Private constructor to prevent direct instantiation.
* Use the static factory methods to create specific instances.
* Returns an instance for cases where the input is not a parseable integer.
* @return An InvalidNumberException with a "not a number" message.
return new InvalidNumberException("Chill, that's not a number! Use something like 'mark 1'.");
* Returns an instance for cases where the task number does not exist in the list.
* @return An InvalidNumberException with an "out of range" message.
return new InvalidNumberException("Man, the number you entered is out of the range of your task list!");
* Returns an instance for cases where the command was given without a number.
* @param command The specific command word (e.g., "mark", "delete") to include in the message.
* @return An InvalidNumberException with a "missing number" message.
return new InvalidNumberException("You need to at least tell me which number to " + command + " hommie!");
* Represents the base exception class for the James application.
* This class serves as the parent for all specific exceptions thrown
* by the James chatbot, allowing for centralized error handling.
* Constructs a new JamesException with the specified detail message.
* @param message The specific error message describing the failure.
* Exception thrown when the user enters a command that the James chatbot
* This class captures the invalid input to provide a personalized error
* Constructs a new UnknownCommandException with a message identifying
* @param command The raw string input that could not be identified as a valid command.
super("I don't know what '" + command + "' means man!");
* Represents a task with a specific deadline.
* A Deadline task includes a date by which the task must be completed,
* in addition to the standard task description and status.
/** The date by which the task is due. */
* Initializes a new Deadline task with a description and a due date.
* @param description The textual description of the task.
* @param deadlineTime The LocalDate representing the deadline.
* Prefixes the representation with "[D]" and appends the deadline
* @return A formatted string displaying task type, status, and due date.
return String.format("[D]%s (by: %s %s %d)", super.toString(), monthName, day, year);
* Identifies the task as "D" and appends the deadline date in YYYY-MM-DD format.
* @return A pipe-separated string formatted for storage.
return String.format("D | %s | %04d-%02d-%02d", super.toFileFormat(), year, month, day);
* Represents a task that occurs within a specific time frame.
* An Event includes a start time and an end time in addition to the
* Initializes a new Event task with a description, start time, and end time.
* @param description The textual description of the event.
* @param startTime The string representation of the start time.
* @param endTime The string representation of the end time.
public Event(String description, String startTime, String endTime) {
* Prefixes the representation with "[E]" and appends the event duration.
* @return A formatted string displaying task type, status, and time range.
return String.format("[E]%s (from: %s to %s)", super.toString(), this.startTime, this.endTime);
* Identifies the task as an "E" and appends the start and end times.
* @return A pipe-separated string formatted for storage.
* Represents a general task in the James application.
* A task consists of a description and a completion status. This class serves
* as a base for more specific types of tasks.
* Initializes a new task with the specified description.
* The task is initially marked as not done.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Returns a status icon representing whether the task is completed.
* "X" indicates completed, and a space " " indicates not completed.
* @return A string icon representing completion status.
* Sets the task's completion status to true.
* Sets the task's completion status to false.
* Returns a string representation of the task, including its status icon and description.
* @return A formatted string suitable for display in the UI.
* Returns a string representation of the task formatted for file storage.
* @return A pipe-separated string containing completion status and description.
* Represents a "Todo" task in the James application.
* A Todo is a basic task that contains only a description and does not have
* any specific date or time constraints.
* Initializes a new Todo task with the specified description.
* @param description The textual description of the todo item.
* Prefixes the task representation with a "[T]" to indicate its type.
* @return A formatted string representation of the Todo task.
* Prefixes the file storage format with "T" to identify it as a Todo.
* @return A string formatted for storage in the data file.
"The date string should be converted into a proper LocalDate object.");
"The parser should split the description, start time, and end time accurately.");
"The parser should correctly identify a completed Todo task from a save string.");
}, "Should throw CanNotFindFileException when the file is missing.");
# 1. Get the absolute path of the project root (one level up from this script)
# This ensures we always know where we are, even if we move folders
# 3. Compile everything from the root - exactly how you do it manually
# 4. RUN - This is the crucial part.
# We run from $PROJ_ROOT so that './data/tasks.txt' resolves to YOUR data folder.
